# Bulgaria–United Kingdom relations__disambig_1

Bulgarian–British relations are bilateral relations between Bulgaria and the United Kingdom.
Bulgaria has an embassy in London. the United Kingdom has an embassy in Sofia.
Both countries are full members of NATO and the Council of Europe, with the United Kingdom giving full support to Bulgaria's applications to join NATO and the European Union. Bulgaria is a European Union member and the United Kingdom is a former European Union member.
Historical relations
Both countries established diplomatic relations in July 1879 as Bulgaria achieved its independence from the Ottoman Empire. The two were enemies during World War I, most of World War II, and the Cold War.
Following the United Kingdom's withdrawal from the European Union, trade between the United Kingdom and European Union members such as Bulgaria has been governed by the EU–UK Trade and Cooperation Agreement since 1 January 2021.
